Description: Painted sycomore fig wood shabti of Neferhotep with a black curled-lappet wig, a pale brown face with black and red features, a red and yellow collar edged with blue, brown hands with black bracelets, the body is painted white, the legs inscribed with a central column of black painted hieroglyphs on a yellow ground with red and blue borders, the back is decorated with the remains of plaster painted with yellow and black.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
